metadata.title: CVE-2023-38039 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: When curl retrieves an HTTP response, it stores the incoming headers sothat they can be accessed later via the libcurl headers API. However, curldid not have a limit in how many or how large headers it would accept in aresponse, allowing a malicious server to stream an endless series ofheaders and eventually cause curl to run out of heap memory.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
